hackathon-description-text: RevolutionUC is a student hackathon in which we invite students from across the midwest to partake in a weekend of code, community, and self-improvement. You don't have to attend the University of Cincinnati and you don't have to be a computer science major or engineering student. We're looking for people who share our passion to do awesome things with technology.
hackathon-requirements: Build something awesome. The hack must be a finished submission and have not been worked on prior to RevolutionUC.
hackathon-rules: RevolutionUC adheres to the MLH Code of Conduct

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Dell Venue Tablets, Courtesy of MLH
Bluetooth speakers, courtesy of Bearcat Hackers
Spark Core development kits, courtesy of Bearcat Hackers
Chromecasts, courtesy of UC Engineering Tribunal. The winner of this prize will be chosen by members from the Engineering Tribunal.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Hacking UC, by UC Engineering Tribunal

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Dell Portable Offline S3 Instance (1TB External Harddrive), courtesy of MLH
Portable Battery, courtesy of Bearcat Hackers. This prize will have preference to teams with high schoolers as the majority of the team.
Amazon Firesticks, courtesy of Bearcat Hackers. This prize will have preference to attendees who are attending RevolutionUC as their first hackathon.
Mini Quadcopters, courtesy of Bearcat Hackers
Pebble Steel Smartwatches, courtesy of MLH
Criteria for the KPCB Fellows Challenge:
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Finalist Position for the 2016 KPCB Fellows Program

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Would the application have real social impact? Can it change the world, or at least help someone in your community? Does the project have a wow factor?
Is the solution novel? Does it solve a problem in a creative or never-seen-before way?
Did the participant(s) solve a hard technical problem? Did they get a working demo completed within the allotted time?

hackathon-description-header: A hackathon at the University of Cincinnati
